item.name: Fulgurite
entries: A natural glass formed when lightning strikes sand, fusing the grains into a glassy tube. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

item.name: Kyanite
entries: A blue silicate mineral made under high pressure. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

item.name: Petrified Wood
entries: A piece of wood that has turned to stone over the ages. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

item.name: Primordial Focus
entries: A primordial focus is the result of extreme elemental force, such as a piece of kyanite, fulgurite, pumice stone, tektite, or petrified wood. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

items: {@item Kyanite|TCP}
{@item Fulgurite|TCP}
{@item Pumice Stone|TCP}
{@item Tektite|TCP}
{@item Petrified Wood|TCP}

item.name: Pumice Stone
entries: A light, porous volcanic rock formed when lava cools quickly. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

item.name: Tektite
entries: A natural glass formed when a meteorite strikes the earth, fusing the surrounding soil into a glassy mass. A conduit can use such an object as a spellcasting focus.

subclassFeature.name: Branded Warrior Spells
entries: At 3rd level, you lean an additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Branded Warrior Spells table. The spells counts as Conduit spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Conduit spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Blazing Combatant
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn Emblems that are fueled by special dice called heat dice

entries.name: Emblems
entries: You learn the Emblems listed below under "Emblems". Many Emblems enhance an attack in some way. You can only use one Emblem per attack

entries.name: Heat Dice
entries: You have a number of heat dice equal to your proficiency bonus, which are {@dice d8}s. A heat die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended heat dice when you finish a short or long rest.

The power of your heat burns brightest at the start of combat, but weans over time. Heat dice diminish in the following sequence: {@dice d8}, {@dice d6}, {@dice d4}. At the start of each of your turns, yous heat die diminishes to the next die in the sequence, down to a minimum of {@dice d4}.
Your maximum heat die increases to a {@dice d10} at 10th level and {@dice d12} at 18th level.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: Some of your Emblems require your target to make a saving throw to resist the Emblem's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

subclassFeature.name: Branded Warrior
entries: It's getting toasty in here eh?

subclassFeature.name: Emblems
entries: The Emblems are presented in alphabetical order.

subclassFeature.name: Familiar Flame
entries: Starting at 6th level, you gain resistance to fire damage. Additionally, while you are concentrating on a spell that deals fire damage, you gain a bonus to any Constitution saving throws you make to maintain concentration on that spell. The bonus equals your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Blaze
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you cast a spell that deals fire damage your Heat of Battle increases by an amount equal to the level of the spell cast.

subclassFeature.name: Ring of Fire
entries: Starting at 15th level, as an action you may ignite a ring of fire centered on a point you can see within 30 feet. The flames burn 10 feet high and 5 feet wide in a 15 foot radius, and last for a minute. Creatures that come into contact with the flames suffer one of the following effects until the end of your next turn.

items: A creature that is immune to fire damage becomes resistant
A creature that is resistant to fire damage has its resistance ignored
All other creatures become vulnerable to fire damage

entries: You can only have one ring active at a time. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again. Alternatively, you may reduce your Heat of Battle by 6 to use the ability again.

subclassFeature.name: Overheat
entries: Starting at 17th level you gain the ability to overheat and burn at new exciting heights. Your Heat of Battle now increases by 3 at the start of your turn instead of 1.

subclassFeature.name: Frost Guardian Spells
entries: At 3rd level, you lean an additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Frost Guardian Spells table. The spells counts as Conduit spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Conduit spells you know.

entries.caption: Frost Guardian Spells
rows: {@spell Rime's Binding Ice|FTD}, {@spell Snilloc's Snowball Swarm|XGE}

subclassFeature.name: Freezing Grasp
entries: At 3rd level, you may use your action to try to freeze an opponent in place. Select a target within 30 feet. That target must make a dexterity saving throw or be grappled until the start of your next turn. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, regaining all uses on a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Icy Pillars
entries: At 3rd level you learn how to create and shape ice to hinder your foes and assist your allies. You gain an amount of Icy Pillars equal to your prof bonus and regain all uses on a short or long rest

As a bonus action you can create any number of pillars up to the amount you have available at a point you can see within 60 feet. Each pillar can be either 5 ft tall, 10 feet thick and 10 ft wide or 10 ft tall and 5 feet thick and 5 ft wide. The pillars all have HP equal to 5 times your level in this class, are immune to Cold, Psychic, and Poison damage, and an AC of 14. You can move a pillar up to 20 feet on your turn as a bonus action. The pillars last for up to a hour, after which they melt harmlessly into the ground.

Additionally, When a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, and you are within 30 feet of a pillar, you can use your reaction to grant that creature resistance to all the damage. When you grant resistance in this way, you select a pillar within 30 feet of you, this pillar takes the same damage as the selected creature.

subclassFeature.name: Frost Guardian
entries: Frost Guardians harness the power of Cold energy to empower and defend themselves and their allies.

subclassFeature.name: Comforting Cold
entries: At 6th level, you've adapted to the cold and it doesn't bother you anymore. You gain resistance to cold damage.

Additionally, your Icy Pillars provide protection to your allies, and freeze the ground to hinder your enemies. If an allied creature comes within 10 feet of a pillar, then they gain temp HP equal to your Wisdom modifier. If a creature moves within 10 feet of a pillar, it must make a dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target is knocked prone. When you create a pillar you can choose any number of creatures to be immune to this effect.

subclassFeature.name: Shattering Frost
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can coat enemies in a brittle layer of frost. As an action you can pick an Icy Pillar you can see and cause it to explode. All enemies in a 15-foot-radius of the pillar must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is coated in ice. The next attack against that creature has advantage, and deals an additional 4d6 cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Frozen Form
entries: At 15th level, a protective layer of ice coats you. The ground around you freezes as you move. The ground in a 10-foot-radius centered on you is considered difficult terrain for enemies. An enemy that starts its turn in this area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Spell Save DC or fall prone.

Additionally, your Icy Pillars influence on allies and enemies increases in range. An enemy starting their turn within 15 ft of one of your Icy Pillars has their movement speed reduced by 10 ft until the end of their turn. If an allied creature starts their turn within 15 ft of a pillar, then they gain temp HP equal to your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Ice Prison
entries: At 18th level, you learn to encase your foes in your Icy Pillars. When you create your Icy Pillars, you can now choose to create them in a creature's space. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Spell Save DC. On a failed save, the creature is grappled and restrained as they become encased in your Icy Pillar. A creature may repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns. On a successful save the creature is freed and moved to the next closest open space to the pillar.

subclassFeature.name: Primeval Soul Spells
entries: At 3rd level, you lean an additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Branded Warrior Spells table. The spells counts as Conduit spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Conduit spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Primeval Soul
entries: Primeval Souls have studied storms and the power of lightning, using it to empower their speed and lethality.

subclassFeature.name: Energy Surge
entries: At 3rd level you harness the energy around you to move fast and strike hard. As a bonus action, you may take a stance for up to a minute. You choose a stance each time you use this feature, and can switch between stances for the duration as a bonus action.

items: Your movement speed increases by 10ft
You gain a fly speed equal to your movement speed. At the end of each of your turns, you will begin to plummet
During your turn, if you make a melee attack against a creature, that creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.
Your movement speed increases by 10ft
You gain a +1 bonus to your AC

When you hit with a weapon attack, you may force the target to make a Strength saving throw. The DC for this save is 8 + Wisdom modifier + Proficiency Bonus. On a failed save, you either force the target away from you 5ft, or knock them prone.

entries: You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus regaining all uses on long rest

subclassFeature.name: TBD
entries: TBD

subclassFeature.name: TBD
entries: TBD

subclassFeature.name: TBD
entries: TBD

subclassFeature.name: TBD
entries: TBD

classFeature.name: Primordial Knowledge
entries: Your understanding of the primordial forces that power you has augmented your mind. At first level, you learn the Primordial language if you don't already know it.

classFeature.name: Primordial Creation
entries: At 1st level, your knowledge and experience with primordial energy aids you in everyday life. Over the course of a minute, you may create or manipulate Acid, Fire, Ice, Thunder and Lightning for up to an hour in the following ways.

items: You may create a small pool of acid to slowly corrode a metal
You may set a flammable object on fire
You may freeze an area of water or create a small amount of ice
You may create a thunderclap audible from 100 feet away
You may shoot a bolt of lightning harmlessly into the air

entries: The effects end if stopped by normal means, such as putting water on a fire, when you dismiss them, or when an hour has passed. You might be able to achieve something beyond the scope of the above examples. State your desired effect to the DM as precisely as possible. All effects must fall within the following confines.

items: You cannot effect an area greater than 1 cubic foot
The cannot directly effect a creature

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Energy Imbuement
entries: When you reach 2nd level, you may empower your damage with one of the following “imbuement damage types”: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder. As a bonus action, you may expend a spell slot to activate this power. While Energy Imbuement is active, your weapon attacks deal extra damage once per turn for the next minute. Expending a 1st level spell slot allows you to add your Wisdom modifier to the damage. A 2nd level slot additionally adds 1d4 damage, with an additional d4 for each level above 2nd. If you are incapacitated, your imbuement immediately ends.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: By the time you reach 2nd level, you have learned to use primordial energy to cast spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the conduit spell list. You learn additional conduit cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Conduit table.
When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one conduit cantrip you know with another cantrip from the conduit spell list.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Conduit table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your conduit spells. To cast one of your conduit spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of conduit spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the conduit spell list. When you do so, choose a number of conduit spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + half your conduit level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 5th-level conduit, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 14, your list of prepared spells can include four spells of 1st or 2nd-level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell cure wounds, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of conduit spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Conduit spells, since you learn your Conduit spells through dedicated study and memorization. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Conduit spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item primordial focus|TCP} as a spellcasting focus for your conduit spells.

classFeature.name: Energy Affinity
entries: At 3rd level, you choose an focus to augment your abilities. Choose one of the options detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, 15th, and 17th level.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility
entries: {@i 4th-level conduit {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you may replace a fighting style you know with another fighting style available to conduits.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

classFeature.name: Energy Affinity Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature based on your Energy Affinity.

classFeature.name: Imbued Defense
entries: When you use the Energy Imbuement feature, you may choose an imbuement damage type to gain resistance to for the duration of your Energy Imbuement.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Energy Affinity Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature based on your Energy Affinity.

classFeature.name: Elemental Mastery
entries: Your mastery of the elements defends you from their effects. You have advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal any of your imbuement damage types.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Overpower Immunity
entries: Beginning at 11th level, when you deal an imbuement damage type to a creature that is immune to that damage, the damage is instead resisted.

classFeature.name: Energy Affinity Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature based on your Energy Affinity.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Energy Affinity Feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature based on your Energy Affinity.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Energetic Conduit
entries: At 20th level, when you hit a creature with an imbued weapon, you may choose to heal for the damage dealt. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier

macro.name: Energy Imbuement

optionalfeature.name: Burning Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a heat die to deal additional fire damage equal to the number rolled on your heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Fiery Precision
entries: When you make a weapon attack roll against a creature, you can expend one heat to add it to the roll. You can use this emblem before or after making the attack roll, but before any effects of the attack are applied.

optionalfeature.name: Flare
entries: When you take the attack action, you may expend a heat die and use a bonus action to throw a dart of fire at a target you can see within 60 feet of you. The dart is a ranged weapon attack with which you are proficient, and the damage is equal to the number rolled on your heat die plus your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Radiating Presence
entries: You can expend one heat die and use a bonus action to coat yourself in flame for 1 minute. During this time, you radiate 10 feet of bright light and 10 feet of dim light.
Additionally, when you use this emblem, roll the expended heat die. Any hostile creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of your takes damage equal to the number rolled on your current heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Revenge of the Pyre
entries: When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one heat die to deal damage equal to the number rolled to the attacking creature.

optionalfeature.name: Rocket Jump
entries: As a bonus action, you may expend a heat die to improve your jumping ability. When you do so, your jumping distance is doubled for the remainder of your turn.

default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
